title.value: Generalizable Imitation Learning Through Pre-Trained Representations
title.justification: This is the title provided at the beginning of the document
title.quote: Generalizable Imitation Learning Through Pre-Trained Representations

extractions.description: This paper introduces BC-ViT, an imitation learning algorithm that utilizes pre-trained DINO Vision Transformer (ViT) features to improve generalization in robotic manipulation tasks. The study includes creating a benchmark based on the Google Scanned Objects dataset and demonstrates improved policy transfer to unseen objects compared to state-of-the-art approaches.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results comparing their proposed BC-ViT model against several baselines, involving collecting datasets and conducting rollouts to evaluate performance.
type.quote: Our experimental results show that our method outperforms both of these approaches.

name.justification: The research focuses on imitation learning for robotic manipulation tasks.
name.quote: Imitation Learning (IL) is a proven method for training complex robot behaviours from demonstrations.

name.justification: The paper specifically addresses imitation learning techniques as a method for robotic manipulation.
name.quote: Imitation Learning (IL) is a proven method for training complex robot behaviours from demonstrations.

name.justification: The paper leverages Vision Transformer (ViT) models pre-trained with DINO to enhance generalization in imitation learning.
name.quote: We introduce BC-ViT, an imitation learning algorithm that leverages rich DINO pre-trained Visual Transformer (ViT) patch-level embeddings.

name.justification: This model is introduced and evaluated as part of the contributions of the paper.
name.quote: We introduce BC-ViT, an imitation learning algorithm that leverages rich DINO pre-trained Visual Transformer (ViT) patch-level embeddings.

is_contributed.justification: The main focus of the paper is the introduction of the BC-ViT model.
is_contributed.quote: We introduce BC-ViT, an imitation learning algorithm that leverages rich DINO pre-trained Visual Transformer (ViT) patch-level embeddings.

is_executed.justification: The paper discusses evaluation and rollouts, indicating execution of the model.
is_executed.quote: Our evaluation then consists of 50 rollouts for each test environment, rotating the test object in the environment to cover 360 degrees.

is_compared.justification: BC-ViT is compared against several baseline models in various experiments.
is_compared.quote: Our experimental results show that our method outperforms both of these approaches.

referenced_paper_title.justification: BC-ViT is presented as a novel contribution in this paper.

name.justification: This model is used as a pre-trained representation for improving generalization in the BC-ViT model.
name.quote: In particular, self-supervised approaches such as DINO exhibit zero-shot emerging abilities such as background-foreground segmentation and encode semantic object-part information in its embeddings.

is_contributed.justification: The DINO Vision Transformers are used as a pre-trained model and were not developed within this paper.
is_contributed.quote: self-supervised approaches such as DINO exhibit zero-shot emerging abilities.

is_executed.justification: DINO ViTs are executed as a part of the embeddings and feature extraction process.
is_executed.quote: In particular, self-supervised approaches such as DINO exhibit zero-shot emerging abilities.

is_compared.justification: The DINO ViT is used as a part of the BC-ViT model and is instrumental in its comparison against other methods.
is_compared.quote: In particular, self-supervised approaches such as DINO exhibit zero-shot emerging abilities.

referenced_paper_title.value: Emerging Properties in Self-Supervised Vision Transformers
referenced_paper_title.justification: DINO is a known model detailed in a separate referenced paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In particular, self-supervised approaches such as DINO exhibit zero-shot emerging abilities.

name.justification: The dataset is mentioned explicitly several times and used for evaluating the robot policies.
name.quote: We develop a benchmark based on a subset of 24 objects from the Google Scanned Objects Dataset.

referenced_paper_title.value: Google Scanned Objects: A High-Quality Dataset of 3D Scanned Household Items
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is referenced and used for the experiments within the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We develop a benchmark based on a subset of 24 objects from the Google Scanned Objects Dataset.

name.justification: The dataset of expert demonstrations is collected specifically for training and evaluating the BC-ViT model.
name.quote: To train the IL agents, we collect a dataset of expert demonstrations through teleoperation.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This dataset is specifically collected and contributed for the experiments in this paper.

name.justification: Robosuite is used as the simulation environment for evaluating the robot policies.
name.quote: All tasks are simulated in Robosuite.

referenced_paper_title.value: robosuite: A Modular Simulation Framework and Benchmark for Robot Learning
